001package tictactoe.console;
002
003import tictactoe.*;
004import java.util.Scanner;
005
006/**
007 * A game of Tic-Tac-Toe played in the console.
008 * 
009 * @author Tapio Malmberg 
010 */
011public class TicTacToe {
012    /**
013     * The minimum width required for the game board.
014     */
015    private static final int MIN_WIDTH = 3;
016
017    /**
018     * The maximum width allowed for the game board.
019     */
020    private static final int MAX_WIDTH = 40;
021
022    /**
023     * The minimum height required for the game board.
024     */
025    private static final int MIN_HEIGHT = 3;
026
027    /**
028     * The maximum height allowed for the game board.
029     */
030    private static final int MAX_HEIGHT = 25;
031
032    /**
033     * The Scanner for reading the user input.
034     */
035    private static Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
036
037    /**
038     * The Tic-Tac-Toe game.
039     */
040    private static TicTacToeGame game;
041
042    /**
043     * The current state of the game.
044     */
045    private static GameState gameState;
046
047    /**
048     * Main program entry point.
049     * @param args not used
050     */
051    public static void main(String[] args) {
052        printInstructions();
053        createGame();
054        playUntilUserQuits();
055    }
056
057    /**
058     * Prints the commands available in the game to the console.
059     */
060    private static void printInstructions() {
061        System.out.println("***************************");
062        System.out.println("*       Tic Tac Toe       *");
063        System.out.println("***************************");
064        System.out.println("u - Undo the previous move.");
065        System.out.println("r - Reset the game.");
066        System.out.println("c - Change settings.");
067        System.out.println("q - Quit the game.");
068        System.out.println();
069    }
070
071    /**
072     * Creates the TicTacToeGame by asking the user for its settings.
073     */
074    private static void createGame() {
075        int width = getValidBound("width", MIN_WIDTH, MAX_WIDTH);
076        int height = getValidBound("height", MIN_HEIGHT, MAX_HEIGHT);
077        int numInARowToWin = getValidNumInARowToWin(width, height);
078        ComputerPlayer computer = getComputerDifficulty();
079        game = new TicTacToeGame(width, height, numInARowToWin, computer, doesComputerMakeFirstMove());
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Gets a valid width or height for the game board from the user.
084     * @param name width or height
085     * @param min the minimum value allowed
086     * @param max the maximum value allowed
087     * @return a valid width or height value
088     */
089    private static int getValidBound(String name, int min, int max) {
090        String range = min + "-" + max;
091        System.out.print("Set game board " + name + " (" + range + "): ");
092        return Utils.readInt(min, max, "Please give a number.", "The " + name + " must be in the range " + range + ".");
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Gets a valid number of pieces in a row needed to win
097     * for the selected game board size.
098     * 
099     * <p>For game boards of size 10x10 and larger,
100     * the minimum number of pieces in a row needed to win is five.
101     * For game boards smaller than 10x10 it is three.</p>
102     * @param width the width of the game board
103     * @param height the height of the game board
104     * @return a valid number of pieces in a row needed to win
105     */
106    private static int getValidNumInARowToWin(int width, int height) {
107        int minInARow = (width >= 10 && height >= 10) ? 5 : 3;
108        int maxInARow = Math.max(width, height);
109        int numInARowToWin = minInARow;
110        if(maxInARow > minInARow) {
111            numInARowToWin = queryUserForNumInARowToWin(minInARow, maxInARow);
112        }
113
114        return numInARowToWin;
115    }
116
117    /**
118     * Gets the number of pieces in a row needed to win from the user.
119     * @param min the minimum value allowed
120     * @param max the maximum value allowed
121     * @return the number of pieces in a row needed to win
122     */
123    private static int queryUserForNumInARowToWin(int min, int max) {
124        String range = min + "-" + max;
125        System.out.print("Set the number of tic-tacs in a row needed to win (" + range + "): ");
126        return Utils.readInt(min, max, "Please give a number.", "Must be in the range " + range + ".");
127    }
128
129    /**
130     * Gets the computer difficulty from the user.
131     * @return a ComputerPlayer with the difficulty the user selected
132     */
133    private static ComputerPlayer getComputerDifficulty() {
134        String options = "1. Random, 2. Smart";
135        System.out.print("Select computer difficulty (" + options + "): ");
136        int choice = Utils.readInt(1, 2, "Please give a number.", options);
137        return choice == 1 ? new RandomComputer() : new SmartComputer();
138    }
139
140    /**
141     * Randomizes whether the computer starts and prints a message to the console.
142     * @return true if the computer makes the first move
143     */
144    private static boolean doesComputerMakeFirstMove() {
145        boolean computerStarts = Utils.getRandom(0, 1) == 1;
146        System.out.print("After a fair coin toss, ");
147        if (computerStarts)
148            System.out.println("the computer gets to make the first move.");
149        else
150            System.out.println("you get to make the first move.");
151        return computerStarts;
152    }
153
154    /**
155     * Keeps playing games of Tic-Tac-Toe until the user chooses to quit.
156     */
157    private static void playUntilUserQuits() {
158        boolean playAnotherGame = true;
159
160        while (playAnotherGame) {
161            playAGame();
162            printGameResult(gameState);
163            playAnotherGame = (gameState != GameState.USER_QUIT) && confirmAnotherGame();
164        }
165    }
166
167    /**
168     * Asks if the user if they want to play another game.
169     * 
170     * <p>The user can also choose to change the settings of the game
171     * or undo the last move.</p>
172     * @return true if the user wants to keep playing
173     */
174    private static boolean confirmAnotherGame() {
175        System.out.print("Play another game (c - change settings, u - undo) [y]/n? ");
176        String answer = input.nextLine().trim();
177        if (answer.length() == 0) {
178            game.reset(doesComputerMakeFirstMove());
179            return true;
180        } else {
181            switch (Character.toLowerCase(answer.charAt(0))) {
182            case 'y':
183                game.reset(doesComputerMakeFirstMove());
184                return true;
185            case Commands.CHANGE_SETTINGS:
186                createGame();
187                return true;
188            case Commands.UNDO:
189                gameState = game.undo();
190                return true;
191            default:
192                return false;
193            }
194        }
195    }
196
197    /**
198     * Plays a game of Tic-Tac-Toe until the end or until the user quits.
199     * 
200     * <p>Keeps printing the game board using GameBoardPrinter and playing rounds
201     * until the game ends.</p>
202     */
203    private static void playAGame() {
204        do {
205            GameBoardPrinter.print(game.getGameBoard());
206            playARound();
207        } while (gameState == GameState.READY_FOR_NEXT_MOVE);
208
209        if (gameState != GameState.USER_QUIT)
210            GameBoardPrinter.print(game.getGameBoard());
211    }
212
213    /**
214     * Asks the user for their move and plays one round of Tic-Tac-Toe.
215     */
216    private static void playARound() {
217        do {
218            System.out.print("Make your move (row column): ");
219            processUserInput(input.nextLine().trim());
220        } while (gameState == GameState.INVALID_PLAYER_MOVE);
221    }
222
223    /**
224     * Processes the input from the user.
225     * 
226     * <p>Processes a command or parses a coordinate
227     * from the user input.</p>
228     * @param userInput a string got from the user
229     */
230    private static void processUserInput(String userInput) {
231        if (userInput.length() == 1) {
232            processCommand(userInput);
233        } else {
234            gameState = game.playARound(parseCoordinate(userInput));
235            if (gameState == GameState.INVALID_PLAYER_MOVE)
236                System.out.println("That is not a valid move.");
237        }
238    }
239
240    /**
241     * Tries to process a single character command got from the user.
242     * 
243     * <p>Changes {@code gameState} accordingly.<p>
244     * @param userInput a string got from the user
245     */
246    private static void processCommand(String userInput) {
247        gameState = GameState.READY_FOR_NEXT_MOVE;
248
249        switch (Character.toLowerCase(userInput.charAt(0))) {
250            case Commands.CHANGE_SETTINGS:
251                createGame();
252                break;
253            case Commands.QUIT:
254                gameState = GameState.USER_QUIT;
255                break;
256            case Commands.RESET:
257                System.out.println("Game reset.");
258                game.reset(doesComputerMakeFirstMove());
259                break;
260            case Commands.UNDO:
261                gameState = game.undo();
262                if (gameState == GameState.INVALID_PLAYER_MOVE)
263                    System.out.println("No undo available.");
264                break;
265            default:
266                System.out.println("Unknown command.");
267                gameState = GameState.INVALID_PLAYER_MOVE;
268            }
269    }
270
271    /**
272     * Parses a Coordinate from the user input.
273     * 
274     * <p>The coordinate can be input in two formats:
275     * "y x" or
276     * "y,x"</p>
277     * @param input a string got from the user
278     * @return the parsed coordinate or null
279     */
280    private static Coordinate parseCoordinate(String input) {
281        String[] yx = input.split("[ ,]");
282
283        try {
284            int y = Integer.parseInt(yx[0]) - 1;
285            int x = Integer.parseInt(yx[1]) - 1;
286
287            return new Coordinate(x, y);
288        } catch (Exception e) {
289            return null;
290        }
291    }
292
293    /**
294     * Prints an appropriate game over message to the console.
295     * @param endState the state the game ended in
296     */
297    private static void printGameResult(GameState endState) {
298        switch (endState) {
299        case PLAYER_WON:
300            System.out.println(":D Congratulations, you won!");
301            break;
302
303        case COMPUTER_WON:
304            System.out.println(":( Too bad, the computer beat you!");
305            break;
306
307        case DRAW_GAME:
308            System.out.println(":| The game ended in a draw.");
309            break;
310
311        case USER_QUIT:
312            System.out.println("Thank you for playing.");
313            break;
314
315        default:
316            System.out.println("ERROR: Unexpected end state.");
317        }
318    }
319}
